data.text: Need a Dog Trailer for Bikepacking with My Dog

I want to get into bikepacking, but I couldn't imagine going without my Nova. She weighs 35lbs. Anyone have recommendations on a trailer? Has anyone done a dog this size on the back of a bike in the basket? Any tips would be greatly appreciated. Thank you in advance
Ride slower and get her trained for distance ;-)
data.author: Christian Maurer

data.text: Always! We like to bike, stop and hike, then bike more, then stop and swim. She's so much fun to go on adventures with!
data.author: Chrissy Garone

data.text:
Check out this guy’s channel, he’s been riding around the world with his dog on a cargo bike for awhile now, you might pick up some tips: https://youtube.com/c/OmniTierra
Omni Tierra - YouTube
youtube.com
data.author: Tony De Jesus

data.text: thank you
data.author: Chrissy Garone

data.text: If you ever change your mind and decide to go bikepacking without her, I'll happily look after her. I live in Australia, but still. Gorgeous doggo.
data.author: Michael Maclean

data.text: thanks, but she never leaves my side
data.author: Chrissy Garone

data.text:
https://bikepacking.com/plan/dogpacking-guide/
Dogpacking 2.0: A Guide to Bikepacking with Your Dog - BIKEPACKING.com
bikepacking.com
data.author: F-Julien Ouellet

data.text: thank you!
data.author: Chrissy Garone

data.text: he wrote 2 articles if I remember well. That's why I found a BOB trailer. :P
data.author: F-Julien Ouellet

data.text: GTT!
data.author: Bobby Jano

data.text: Check out the Ryan Van Duzer videos where he is riding with his friends John and Mira. John has traveled many miles with Mira, she has a area where she can ride on the back of the bike.
data.author: Mark Owsley

data.text: I love how everyone is recommending him. Watching some of his videos now. Thank you very much
data.author: Chrissy Garone

data.text: yep looks like same breed and size of dog as well. Plenty of advice on his videos.
data.author: Jon Manning

data.text: My dog is over 60 lbs. We do a couple of road rides that are over 100 miles. We also ride the gravel in montana every summer. Bout 750 miles in 2 weeks. He is part of me do i have complained bout the weight. But i do complain bout chewing the tops off of water bottles when its 100 degrees out!
data.author: Doug Terrien
Doug Terrien

data.text: ... and Suits2Sandals. They are a couple who travelled the length of the East Coast Greenway (Maine to FLA). Their doggo was with them and travelled in a Burley Tail Wagon. Based on their experience I purchased one for my doggo and I'm in the process of working with him to ride in it 🙂
data.author: Deb Robert

data.text: My 50lb. Kelpie, Flint, comes with me. He rides in a Burley Coho single wheel trailer. It was a slow process getting him comfortable with it. I replaced the stock tire with one that is 3 inches wide (also by Burley). This gave the trailer more stability. All in all its much slower and a lot heavier taking a dog, but it's also wonderful to have him out there with me.
data.author: Robert E. Livingood
Justin Serpico

data.text: Robert E. Livingood I'll probably go this route (Burley Coho) next year when my dog starts deteriorating enough hiking at a high level is harder. He's 12.5 now and has a herniated disc, otherwise would still be in great health but the disc is screwing him. Would be a good way to get him out with us and do some new adventures.
data.author: Justin Serpico

data.text: I LOVE those ears!
data.author: Chrissy Garone

data.text: I know what you mean!!
data.author: Robert E. Livingood

data.text: What a cool looking / acting dog! You'll figure it out with some good advice from everyone! Have fun, or why do it!
data.author: Sean Herd

data.text: frances cycles makes trailers that definitely see some dog action
data.author: Lucas Ehster

data.text: I miss my boy every time I ride. Yours is a gorgeous dog.
data.author: Richard Ryan

data.text: I pull my 2 kids (65 lbs together) in a Burley trailer - I have the fat tire kit for it which helps on rougher gravel roads. I’ve even taken it on some double track but just short distances. I love the burley and I know they make a pet specific trailer as well. You will definitely feel it during climbs though and your overall speed will be slower. But it’s a great workout! When I ride without my kids I feel like I’m flying 😆
data.author: Gwen Maloney

data.text: Check out Cass Gilbert (While out riding) on Insta.
data.author: Nick Mandeville

data.text: will do, thanks
data.author: Chrissy Garone

data.text: We plan our bike packing trips to be shorter. Our pup can average 20-30 miles a day. So, to enjoy our trip with the pup, we just do less miles. It’s the journey right 🙂
data.author: Jackie Archer
Jackie Archer

data.text: Check out the hashtag dogpacking on Instagram. Lot’s of inspiration there. I’ve done several overnighters with Logan (my dog) he is a great companion on adventures.
data.author: Bryan Harms

data.text: will do, thank you
data.author: Chrissy Garone

data.text: I go with mine. I just stick to about 20k/day chilled out rides. I love our trips

data.text: She's a border collie...when fit (which she looks), these guys can easily cover 20 miles. Check out Omni Tierra youtube. Mira rides in a basket on the back or runs beside him.

data.text: That’s a crate from Uline, called a short double crate if I recall. They only come in 2-3 packs (at the time) but they aren’t pricey.

don't have a dog ( yet ) but used this one for many years , came with a fitted bag, and will carry my tent, food and more on our west scot island trip in July https://www.bobgear.com/yak-bike-trailer

data.author: Jeff Glessing

data.text: I’ve been using the Burley Nomad trailer to pull my dog and camping gear. The trailer only weighs 14.5 pounds. My dog is 23 pounds. I’ve ridden cross country two times pulling that trailer and LOVE it! Highly recommend!
